Wait a minute...I see now why you were talking about "subconscious" as a te=
rm. It was because I said it was the scientific term for the astral. So yes=
, your right, it wasn't a true scientific term. I just meant it was more of=
 a tangible way of explaining it. I guess the true scientific term would be=
 your unconscious mind, or Feud's ID.

Sorry, I had to mull it over a bit L=
OL!

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: SnowfireL@... 
  To: EVP-I=
TC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 9:21 AM
  Subject: Re: =
[EVP-ITC] sounds like,






  Truly spoken!

  In a message dated 5/20/200=
9 11:19:20 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time, april@... w=
rites:



    =EF=BB=BF 

    Science people will tell you there is no astr=
al. The term "Astral" was coined by the first people who experienced this r=
ealm. But all words were coined. Even words such as dog or cat. 

    Also,=
 subconscious means below conscious or not conscious. So it isn't incorrect=
, though maybe some scholarly types will tell you it isn't proper. Again, a=
ll words were coined.

    You have to remember that colleges and schools a=
re mostly made up by people, people who think only scientifically. I know-n=
ot all people in colleges think this way, but that is what learning institu=
tions are based on. They reject any term they can't grasp or understand und=
er a microscope.

    All this is besides the point though.


      ----- O=
riginal Message ----- 
      From: SnowfireL@... 
      To: EVP-ITC@yah=
oogroups.com 
      Sent: Wednesday, May 20, 2009 9:05 AM
      Subject: Re=
: [EVP-ITC] sounds like,



      The word is really unconscious, the word =
sub. was coined by lay people, but any psychologist will tell us the word t=
o use is unconscious because it is the correct term, Psych's make a joke ab=
out us  lay people using the word subconscious to mean the same thing,  I h=
ad 12 credits toward my PhD but, til ran out of money.  I understand what y=
ou are saying though, the word "astral" is also a made up word, as is many =
of the new terms out there like "ascended master" and "channel" I think the=
y refer to guide and medium, respectively.sf

      In a message dated 5/20=
/2009 10:54:36 A.M. Eastern Daylight Time, april@abercrombieghostresearch.c=
om writes:
        subconscious
